newsitem.title: USA: AVAX votes reverse stock split.
newsitem.headline: AVAX votes reverse stock split.

text.p: AVAX Technologies Inc said its board of directors and a majority of its shareholders have approved a one-for-two reverse stock split effective at the close of trading on May 13.

In a release dated May 7, the company said shareholders will receive one new combined common share for every two they hold as of May 13. Cash will be paid in lieu of fractional shares, based upon the May 13 closing date.
AVAX said the reverse split is an attempt to satisfy the Nasdaq's SmallCap Market's minimum bid price requirement for an initial listing of $3.00 per share.

As of May 1, the company had about 6.3 million common shares outstanding, or about 22.6 million common shares on a fully diluted basis. After the split, it will have about 3.1 million common shares outstanding, the company said.
AVAX last traded at 2-9/16 on Monday.
